snippet: Cellphone tracking cannot be allowed to trample the Fourth Amendment.
abstract: Editorial underscores importance of federal appeals court ruling restricting government's access to customer location data stored by cellphone companies; warns that capacity of cellphones to track people's movements poses substantial and growing threat to privacy; calls on judges and lawmakers to make sure that technology is not improperly used to get around Fourth Amendment protections.
lead_paragraph: Cellphone tracking cannot be allowed to trample the Fourth Amendment.

headline.seo: Cellphone Tracking Cannot Trample the Fourth Amendment
